content.location: This route is just right of center on the Cantara Loop crag.

content.description: Climb the  and right facing dihedral furtherest to the the right on the crag. There is no discernible crux, but this route has some fun easy moves with plenty of good stances for placing gear.
content.protection: Single rack for pro. The anchor is bolted.
content.location: This is the right most route on the Cantara Loop crag.

content.description:
Want to scramble up a mossy, chossy, and dirty sport route? It could clean up eventually.

I linked both pitches, and rappelled back to the ground from the top anchor with a 70m rope.

The first pitch follows bolted blocks trending right  (5.5). The second pitch goes up a steeper lichen covered face (5.9). With some cleaning, this second pitch might eventually become easier.

The bolts are all in good condition. There is a lot of loose rock.
content.protection: Bolts for both pitches and bolted anchors for both belays. The top anchor has two chains, the first anchor has only one. All bolts are in good condition.
content.location: This route is the farthest to the right (10’ right of the 5.6 right facing dihedral)

content.description: Short sport climb. Climb face and go around the arete.
content.protection: 3 bolts to two bolt anchor with chains (shared with the 5.6 dihedral to the right)
content.location: Second rightmost route on the crag.

content.description:
Tallest and most prominent feature on the rock.

Climb up to the bolt under the bulge/roof, bust right then a good rest, then fire it to the top.
content.location: Left side of the rock, to the right of Komatose (bolted sport line)

content.description: The crux is probably a big throw to jug on the roof.
content.location: Climbs the big roof. Hard to miss.

content.description:
Okay, so this is rated 5.10+ in the State of Jefferson guide and 5.7 in the Shasta Area guide. I’ll split the difference and call it a 5.9, which honestly feels right.

The route starts up a bulge and pulls onto a face with a crack and little finger pods. Then links up with the Peregrine anchor.

Fun movement especially on the lower section.
content.protection: Bolts (4 or 5) to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Left of the 5.7 dihedral (with the funky U shaped bar) and right of Peregrine.

content.description: Great bolted sport route. This is a new route that is not shown on the topo/photo of the current picture of Cantera Loop.
content.location: Sport route on the far left side, left of The Tower 5.9
